vr:Summary.vr:Description: This is part of the astrogrid CEA.
This is part of the astrogrid CEA.

cea:ParameterDefinition.name: LMAX
cea:ParameterDefinition.ceapd:UI_Description: LMIN and LMAX are the indices of the evolutionary tracks, sorted by mass. Normally you do not want to mess with the variable and leave it at 0. However, if you want to track down some peculiarity of the output, you may want to compute the parameters for only one track. For instance, specifying 21,21 indicates that only a 100 M star should by used, and everything else is suppressed. The cross-ID's between index and mass are at the bottom of the input file. The example here refers to JMG=1 or 2. For JMG=0, you would have chosen 5,5. This does not apply to JMG=3 since the mass grid is variable and LMIN, LMAX are not used.

cea:ParameterDefinition.name: LMIN
cea:ParameterDefinition.ceapd:UI_Description: LMIN and LMAX are the indices of the evolutionary tracks, sorted by mass. Normally you do not want to mess with the variable and leave it at 0. However, if you want to track down some peculiarity of the output, you may want to compute the parameters for only one track. For instance, specifying 21,21 indicates that only a 100 M star should by used, and everything else is suppressed. The cross-ID's between index and mass are at the bottom of the input file. The example here refers to JMG=1 or 2. For JMG=0, you would have chosen 5,5. This does not apply to JMG=3 since the mass grid is variable and LMIN, LMAX are not used.

cea:ParameterDefinition.name: wrlines
cea:ParameterDefinition.ceapd:UI_Description: output file

cea:ParameterDefinition.name: sptyp2
cea:ParameterDefinition.ceapd:UI_Description: output file

cea:ParameterDefinition.name: power
cea:ParameterDefinition.ceapd:UI_Description: output file

cea:ParameterDefinition.name: ewidth
cea:ParameterDefinition.ceapd:UI_Description: output file

cea:ParameterDefinition.name: snr
cea:ParameterDefinition.ceapd:UI_Description: output file

cea:ParameterDefinition.name: UPMA
cea:ParameterDefinition.ceapd:UI_Description: upper mass limit for the IMF.

cea:ParameterDefinition.name: ALPHA
cea:ParameterDefinition.ceapd:UI_Description: IMF exponent. A power law is assumed.(2.35 = SALPETER):

cea:ParameterDefinition.name: SFR
cea:ParameterDefinition.ceapd:UI_Name: SFR [SOLAR MASSES PER YEAR] IF 'CONT. SF' IS CHOSEN:
cea:ParameterDefinition.ceapd:UI_Description: the star formation rate (only used for a continuous rate). The total accumulated mass is spread out between the upper and lower cut-off masses.

cea:ParameterDefinition.name: TOMA
cea:ParameterDefinition.ceapd:UI_Name: TOTAL STELLAR MASS [10^6 SOLAR MASSES] IF 'FIXED MASS' IS CHOSEN
cea:ParameterDefinition.ceapd:UI_Description: this is the total stellar mass (spread out between the upper and lower cut-off masses). It is only used if an instantaneous burst is specified.

cea:ParameterDefinition.name: TMAX
cea:ParameterDefinition.ceapd:UI_Description: [1.e6 YEARS]: the oldest age of the model.

cea:ParameterDefinition.name: sptyp1
cea:ParameterDefinition.ceapd:UI_Description: output file

cea:ParameterDefinition.name: SNCUT
cea:ParameterDefinition.ceapd:UI_Description: stars with ZAMS masses of 8 M and higher form supernovae. This is the suggested standard value but can be modified if desired.

cea:ParameterDefinition.name: STEP
cea:ParameterDefinition.ceapd:UI_Description: [1.e6 years] this is the timestep used for the calculations. It is a very important parameter. On the one hand, the computing time scales with STEP, so you want to avoid too high resolution, but on the other, short evolutionary phases can be missed. 0.1 (i.e. 10e5 yr) is a good value if you use full isochrone synthesis. If full isochrone synthesis is not used, 0.1 or larger is suggested only for tests --- be aware that WR or RSG numbers are no longer properly calculated for a STEP of 0.1 unless full isochrone synthesis is selected!

cea:ParameterDefinition.name: quanta
cea:ParameterDefinition.ceapd:UI_Description: output file

cea:ParameterDefinition.name: ISF
cea:ParameterDefinition.ceapd:UI_Name: CONTINUOUS STAR FORMATION (>0) OR FIXED MASS (<=0)
cea:ParameterDefinition.ceapd:UI_Description: if this is a negative integer, star formation is instantaneous, otherwise it is continuous.

cea:ParameterDefinition.name: ovi
cea:ParameterDefinition.ceapd:UI_Description: output file

cea:ParameterDefinition.name: JMG
cea:ParameterDefinition.ceapd:UI_Name: SMALL (=0) OR LARGE (=1) MASS GRID; ISOCHRONE ON LARGE GRID (=2) OR FULL ISOCHRONE (=3):
cea:ParameterDefinition.ceapd:UI_Description: these are four options for the interpolation in mass. They are explained in the code. Shortly: 0 -- evolutionary synthesis with a mass resolution of 5 M (only recommended for tests); 1 -- same as 0, but with a resolution of 1 M. This method was used in Leitherer & Heckman (1995); 2 -- isochrone synthesis with a fixed mass resolution of 1 M; 3 -- isochrone synthesis with a variable mass grid. This is the fanciest method and is the recommended mode.

cea:ParameterDefinition.name: TDEL
cea:ParameterDefinition.ceapd:UI_Description: [1.e6YR] the file containing the output spectrum can be pretty big. This parameter controls the time step to print out the spectrum. This is independent of the time resolution -- only the print out is affected! 1 Myr is usually a good value but if you compute the starburst up to 100 Myr, you may prefer TDEL=5 Myr unless you have many Gb of disk space.

cea:ParameterDefinition.name: DOMA
cea:ParameterDefinition.ceapd:UI_Description: lower mass limit for the IMF.

cea:ParameterDefinition.name: IZ
cea:ParameterDefinition.ceapd:UI_Description: 92-94 STD. MASS-LOSS: 11=0.001; 12=0.004; 13=0.008; 14=0.020; 15=0.040 92-94 HIGH MASS-LOSS: 21=0.001; 22=0.004; 23=0.008; 24=0.020; 25=0.040 24 -- this integer indicates the evolutionary tracks to be used. The choices are 11-15 or 21-25, where the former select one of five metallicities with the standard tracks, and the latter do the same for the high mass-loss tracks. Example: "23" selects 40% solar metallicity with the high mass loss tracks.

cea:ParameterDefinition.name: IVT
cea:ParameterDefinition.ceapd:UI_Description: atmospheric parameters used for the spectral features in the near-IR. Detailed explanations are in the sp-feature subroutine. Defaults are 3,0, i.e. microturbulent velocities of 3 km/sec and solar abundance ratios for alpha-element/Fe

cea:ParameterDefinition.name: uvline
cea:ParameterDefinition.ceapd:UI_Description: output file

cea:ParameterDefinition.name: hires
cea:ParameterDefinition.ceapd:UI_Description: output file

cea:ParameterDefinition.name: output
cea:ParameterDefinition.ceapd:UI_Description: output file

cea:ParameterDefinition.name: BHCUT
cea:ParameterDefinition.ceapd:UI_Description: stars with ZAMS masses of 120 M and lower form supernovae. An alternative scenario would be to let stars above a certain threshold form a black hole. For instance, BHCUT=40. results in SNe only from the mass range 40 to 8 M.

cea:ParameterDefinition.name: TIME1
cea:ParameterDefinition.ceapd:UI_Description: [1.E6 YEARS] the epoch of the onset of the star formation. In almost all cases you want this to be close to 0. It should not be exactly 0 for numerical reasons. 0.01 (i.e. 10e4 yr) is a good number.

cea:ParameterDefinition.name: IRSG
cea:ParameterDefinition.ceapd:UI_Description: atmospheric parameters used for the spectral features in the near-IR. Detailed explanations are in the sp-feature subroutine. Defaults are 3,0, i.e. microturbulent velocities of 3 km/sec and solar abundance ratios for alpha-element/Fe

cea:ParameterDefinition.name: ILINE
cea:ParameterDefinition.ceapd:UI_Name: METALLICITY OF THE UV LINE SPECTRUM:
cea:ParameterDefinition.ceapd:UI_Description: 1=SOLAR, 2=LMC/SMC) [ILINE] 1 -- a switch for the choice of the UV spectral library. This switch applies to both the FUSE and the HST/IUE libraries. It is independent of the metallicity of the tracks/atmospheres. Normally one would use ILINE=1 with IZ=24 and ILINE=2 with IZ=22.

cea:ParameterDefinition.name: IWIND
cea:ParameterDefinition.ceapd:UI_Description: (0=MAEDER; 1=EMP.; 2=THEOR.; 3=ELSON; 4=UCL): [IWIND] 2 -- this selects the wind model to be used for the calculation of the wind power. The four models are discussed in ApJ, 401, 498 (1992) and in Smith et al. (2002). "2" is the suggested default parameter.

cea:ParameterDefinition.name: spectrum
cea:ParameterDefinition.ceapd:UI_Description: output file

cea:ParameterDefinition.name: color
cea:ParameterDefinition.ceapd:UI_Description: output file

cea:ParameterDefinition.name: hrd
cea:ParameterDefinition.ceapd:UI_Description: output file

cea:ParameterDefinition.name: IATMOS
cea:ParameterDefinition.ceapd:UI_Description: 1=PLA,2=LEJ,3=LEJ+SCH,4=LEJ+HIL,5=PAU+HIL [IATMOS] 5 -- this is the choice of the model atmosphere. 1 is a bare-bone version with black bodies, good only for tests. 2 uses the Kurucz models as compiled by Lejeune for all stars. 3 uses Lejeune for stars with plane-parallel atmospheres and Schmutz for stars with strong winds. 4 uses Lejeune, but replaces the Schmutz by the Hillier atmospheres. 5 is like 4, except for the O atmospheres, for which we use the Pauldrach models. 5 is the recommended value.

cea:ParameterDefinition.name: yield
cea:ParameterDefinition.ceapd:UI_Description: output file

cea:ParameterDefinition.name: irfeature
cea:ParameterDefinition.ceapd:UI_Description: output file

cea:ParameterDefinition.name: NAME
cea:ParameterDefinition.ceapd:UI_Description: any identifier you want to assign to the model. You will find it in the header of each output file.

vr:Summary.vr:Description: This is part of the astrogrid CEA.
This is part of the astrogrid CEA.

cea:ParameterDefinition.name: output_catalog
cea:ParameterDefinition.ceapd:UI_Description: The catalogue of estimated redshifts

cea:ParameterDefinition.name: config_file
cea:ParameterDefinition.ceapd:UI_Description: A HyperZ configuration file

cea:ParameterDefinition.name: input_catalog
cea:ParameterDefinition.ceapd:UI_Description: The input catalogue of measured magnitude

vr:Summary.vr:Description: This is part of the astrogrid CEA.
This is part of the astrogrid CEA.

cea:ParameterDefinition.name: PROBS_LITE
cea:ParameterDefinition.ceapd:UI_Description: Save only the final probability distribution

cea:ParameterDefinition.name: ZMIN
cea:ParameterDefinition.ceapd:UI_Description: minimum redshift

cea:ParameterDefinition.name: MADAU
cea:ParameterDefinition.ceapd:UI_Description: Apply Madau correction to spectra

cea:ParameterDefinition.name: GET_Z
cea:ParameterDefinition.ceapd:UI_Description: Actually obtain photo-z

cea:ParameterDefinition.name: DZ
cea:ParameterDefinition.ceapd:UI_Description: redshift resolution

cea:ParameterDefinition.name: PROBS
cea:ParameterDefinition.ceapd:UI_Description: Save all the galaxy probability distributions (very large file created)

cea:ParameterDefinition.name: MAG
cea:ParameterDefinition.ceapd:UI_Description: Data in magnitudes?

cea:ParameterDefinition.name: EXCLUDE
cea:ParameterDefinition.ceapd:UI_Description: Filters to be excluded from the estimation

cea:ParameterDefinition.name: Z_THR
cea:ParameterDefinition.ceapd:UI_Description: Integrate likelihood for z>z_thr

cea:ParameterDefinition.name: ZMAX
cea:ParameterDefinition.ceapd:UI_Description: maximum redshift

cea:ParameterDefinition.name: PRIOR
cea:ParameterDefinition.ceapd:UI_Description: prior name

cea:ParameterDefinition.name: CHECK
cea:ParameterDefinition.ceapd:UI_Description: Perform some checks, compare observed colors with templates, etc.

cea:ParameterDefinition.name: COLOR
cea:ParameterDefinition.ceapd:UI_Description: Use colors instead of fluxes

cea:ParameterDefinition.name: ONLY_TYPE
cea:ParameterDefinition.ceapd:UI_Description: Use spectroscopic redshifts instead of photo-z

cea:ParameterDefinition.name: SPECTRA
cea:ParameterDefinition.ceapd:UI_Description: template list

cea:ParameterDefinition.name: NEW_AB
cea:ParameterDefinition.ceapd:UI_Description: If yes, generate new AB files even if they already exist

cea:ParameterDefinition.name: ODDS
cea:ParameterDefinition.ceapd:UI_Description: Odds threshold: affects confidence limits definition

cea:ParameterDefinition.name: VERBOSE
cea:ParameterDefinition.ceapd:UI_Description: Print estimated redshifts to the standard output

cea:ParameterDefinition.name: INTERP
cea:ParameterDefinition.ceapd:UI_Description: Number of interpolated templates between each of the original ones

cea:ParameterDefinition.name: PLOTS
cea:ParameterDefinition.ceapd:UI_Description: produce plots

vr:Summary.vr:Description: This is part of the astrogrid CEA.

cea:ParameterDefinition.name: CATALOG_NAME
cea:ParameterDefinition.ceapd:UI_Description: The catalogue of images derived from the input images

cea:ParameterDefinition.name: GAIN
cea:ParameterDefinition.ceapd:UI_Description: detector gain in e-/ADU

cea:ParameterDefinition.name: MASK_TYPE
cea:ParameterDefinition.ceapd:UI_Description: type of detection MASKing: can be one of "NONE", "BLANK" or "CORRECT"

cea:ParameterDefinition.name: CLEAN
cea:ParameterDefinition.ceapd:UI_Description: Clean spurious detections? (Y or N)?

cea:ParameterDefinition.name: FILTER
cea:ParameterDefinition.ceapd:UI_Description: apply filter for detection

cea:ParameterDefinition.name: FILTER_NAME
cea:ParameterDefinition.ceapd:UI_Description: the convolution filter

cea:ParameterDefinition.name: MAG_ZEROPOINT
cea:ParameterDefinition.ceapd:UI_Description: magnitude zero-point

cea:ParameterDefinition.name: MAG_GAMMA
cea:ParameterDefinition.ceapd:UI_Description: gamma of emulsion (for photographic scans)

cea:ParameterDefinition.name: CHECKIMAGE_NAME
cea:ParameterDefinition.ceapd:UI_Description: file containing the checkimage

cea:ParameterDefinition.name: PIXEL_SCALE
cea:ParameterDefinition.ceapd:UI_Description: size of pixel in arcsec (0=use FITS WCS info)

cea:ParameterDefinition.name: IMAGE_BAND
cea:ParameterDefinition.ceapd:UI_Description: The input image measuerment band. This is used to form the column name in the output VOTable for the measured photometry.

cea:ParameterDefinition.name: PHOT_AUTOPARAMS
cea:ParameterDefinition.ceapd:UI_Description: MAG_AUTO parameters: <Kron_fact>,>min_radius>

cea:ParameterDefinition.name: PARAMETERS_NAME
cea:ParameterDefinition.ceapd:UI_Description: A File containing the list of catalogue paramters that should be computed

cea:ParameterDefinition.name: config_file
cea:ParameterDefinition.ceapd:UI_Description: File containing the main configuration parameters for SExtractor

cea:ParameterDefinition.name: SEEING_FWHM
cea:ParameterDefinition.ceapd:UI_Description: stellar FWHM in arcsec

cea:ParameterDefinition.name: DETECT_THRESH
cea:ParameterDefinition.ceapd:UI_Description: sigmas or threshold,ZP in mag.arcsec-2

cea:ParameterDefinition.name: DETECT_MINAREA
cea:ParameterDefinition.ceapd:UI_Description: minimum number of pixels above threshold

cea:ParameterDefinition.name: DEBLEND_NTHRESH
cea:ParameterDefinition.ceapd:UI_Description: Number of deblending sub-thresholds

cea:ParameterDefinition.name: CLEAN_PARAM
cea:ParameterDefinition.ceapd:UI_Description: Cleaning Efficiency

cea:ParameterDefinition.name: STARNNW_NAME
cea:ParameterDefinition.ceapd:UI_Description: Neural-Network_Weight table filename

cea:ParameterDefinition.name: DetectionImage
cea:ParameterDefinition.ceapd:UI_Description: The image that is used to detect sources. Basic position, shape and size informtaion is derived from this image

cea:ParameterDefinition.name: DEBLEND_MINCONT
cea:ParameterDefinition.ceapd:UI_Description: Minimum contrast parameter for deblending

cea:ParameterDefinition.name: PhotoImage
cea:ParameterDefinition.ceapd:UI_Description: The Image that is used to measure photometric parameters

cea:ParameterDefinition.name: ANALYSIS_THRESH
cea:ParameterDefinition.ceapd:UI_Description: sigmas or threshold,ZP in mag.arcsec-2

cea:ParameterDefinition.name: PHOT_APERTURES
cea:ParameterDefinition.ceapd:UI_Description: MAG_APER aperture diameter(s) in pixels

vr:Summary.vr:Description: This is part of the astrogrid CEA.

cea:ParameterDefinition.name: IMAGEOUT_NAME
cea:ParameterDefinition.ceapd:UI_Description: The resampled and possibly coadded output image

cea:ParameterDefinition.name: config_file
cea:ParameterDefinition.ceapd:UI_Description: File containing the main configuration parameters for Swarp

cea:ParameterDefinition.name: Image
cea:ParameterDefinition.ceapd:UI_Description: The image that is used to detect sources. Basic position, shape and size informtaion is derived from this image

vr:Summary.vr:Description: This is part of the astrogrid CEA.

cea:ParameterDefinition.name: matches
cea:ParameterDefinition.ceapd:UI_Description: The VOTable file containing the sources to match

cea:ParameterDefinition.name: output
cea:ParameterDefinition.ceapd:UI_Description: This can be one of HTML VOTable of Ascii, with the default being VOTable

cea:ParameterDefinition.name: merged_output
cea:ParameterDefinition.ceapd:UI_Description: The VOTable file containing result of the match

cea:ParameterDefinition.name: maxMatches
cea:ParameterDefinition.ceapd:UI_Name: maximum number of matches per target
cea:ParameterDefinition.ceapd:UI_Description: maximum number of matches per target

cea:ParameterDefinition.name: targets
cea:ParameterDefinition.ceapd:UI_Description: The VOTable file containing the target sources
